website_summaries.verdict: Simple operation and elegant design, housed in a heavy-duty case. Looks great next to your turntable.
pros: Features switchable input capacitance between 100pf and 200pf, with a low cut filter switch on the front panel to make sure your audio is pristine
The smooth lines of the heavy-duty black anodized case also look great on anyone's stereo rack
cons: The unit is not built with a power switch, and therefore has a very bright blue power light that does stay on all the time

website_summaries.verdict: A terrific preamplifier that acts as an interface between your turntable and your audio recording and playback system.
pros: Offers front gain trim control and a signal or clip LED that allows you to optimize the preamplifier's gain for a wide range of input sources
Includes a switchable low-cut rumble filter
Comes with built-in low-noise phono preamp circuitry that precisely conforms to the RIAA standard
cons: May emit a low-frequency humming noise
Does not include a power switch

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Pre-amp. I purchased Pyle pre-amp for $14 here ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent Pre-amp. I purchased Pyle pre-amp for $14 here on Amazon. I was excited to get it for my turntable. Once it was hooked up there was super loud hum coming from the speakers I did everything I could but had no success. So i decided to go with something more expensive. This pre-amp is excellent. There is no hum coming from the speakers and it works great. Construction is excellent. Get It! Don't forget to connect ground from your turntable to this pre-amp. My setup: Gemini XL-500 II
customer_reviews.author: PiO

customer_reviews.title: Great device
customer_reviews.text: Much louder than the integrated line out on my Fluance turntable and there isn't any distortion. Sounds great without having to crank up the amp, so happy. The build is also excellent, feels really solid. BTW, found this power supply that actually has an on/off switch and it works perfectly, it's.
customer_reviews.author: nothingness

customer_reviews.title: Lively reproduction
customer_reviews.text: For this price point, there is nothing to dislike. I have an AT LP 120 Turntable and running through a Sony Pro Logic amp that was built in 1992. I was using the internal preamp which has a good sound. I was thinking a dedicated preamp would enhance the sound and I was right. The instruments in playback seem much more real and there is no muddy sound. I have both the low cut and the 200 capacitance button activated and the sound is better. I am sure if I paid for a high-end preamp that I would have a better sound but for the price, I am very happy with this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Lewis O. Paddock

customer_reviews.title: Great sound reproduction from albums
customer_reviews.text: Connected my phonograph player to my home theater system using this product. No grounding was needed. No hum or any other noise was produced by the audio device. My albums played well with their natural sound loud and clear. I did very little adjusting as everything was good straight out the box. The LED light is bright as other reviewers stated and I unplugged it after use to avoid the brightness. I experienced no issues at all and am very pleased with the quality and sound of records. Very easy to hook up.
customer_reviews.author: S. Borrelli

customer_reviews.title: works as expected, but finish detracts from satisfaction
customer_reviews.text: use with a vintage onkyo turntable (denon receiver/NAD amp/Magnepan speakers). 1st experience with turntable/vinyl and preamp seems to do what is expected with no added noise. like the adjustable gain and output/filters for a bit of added control and tweaking ability. taking away 1 star because the lights are really bright and mostly unnecessary. can cover with tape, but still annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Tim E

customer_reviews.title: Need a preamp? New to all this? Get this.
customer_reviews.text: If you’re looking for a turntable preamp and don’t want to break the bank, this is a solid little pre. Sound is solid, it’s built like a tank, and the price is good. Only downside is the power light is always on and excruciatingly bright blue. Oh and you can’t turn it off without unplugging it, so expect it to light up a dark room. Or find some electrical tape.
customer_reviews.author: G.B. Bowers

customer_reviews.title: Works Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I got the preamp today. I hooked my Technics SL-DD33 turntable to the amp and then to the Yamaha RX-V465 reciever. My records sound great and no hum. Not sure how long this will last but so far so good. I attached the ground from the turntable to the preamp. It would be nice if there was a switch to turn the preamp off. I could plug it into a power strip and then shut the power strip off. Thanks for all the information in the other reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Stadler

customer_reviews.title: Maybe I Got a Bad One
customer_reviews.text: The product looks great, nice build quality. Everything was in the package. I installed according to instructions and the level of distortion was completely unacceptable. Noise, distortion, buzz...horrible. I then tried it with a different receiver and turntable with the same result. I have seen good reviews and bad ones and I am not buying this same item again. If there is this much of a QC issue, they don't get a second chance.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Not good for electronic music & produces hiss
customer_reviews.text: It has a strong build design. As many others have said the light on front is extremely bright. I didnt have high expectations due to the price of this device. For recording hot pressed/electronic music, it cant handle the input. The indicator light clips at a very low volume & produces very quiet recordings. Audible hiss as reported by others is correct. But for $50 still not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: BTankst

customer_reviews.title: I may have gotten even better sound by spending hundreds more but this pre is ...
customer_reviews.text: Compact and solidly built, the ART DJPRE II made a significant improvement over the internal pre-amp in my Fluance turntable. Where before installing the pre-amp the sound was tinny with no bottom end with low volume, that changed after installing the pre-amp along with new high quality RCA cables. I may have gotten even better sound by spending hundreds more but this pre is a bona fide value.The blue power light is way bright but I have it where its not annoying and have installed an in-line on/off switch so its not on when not in use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Oh YES...
customer_reviews.text: Remember the scene in the WIZARD OF OZ when it turned from Black and white to gorgeous technicolor? That's what happened with the sound from my vintage Kenwood turntable after I hooked up this lovely beast of an amp. Love the manual control knob for adjusting the fidelity/volume as needed. Make sure to upgrade your RCA cable also.
customer_reviews.author: Namaste

customer_reviews.title: Good choice for money
customer_reviews.text: Needed this for a second system with a turntable I found at goodwill. On my main system I use the Pro-ject I purchased about 15 or 20 years ago, so that’s the only thing I can compare this to. The adjustable gain is a plus for this unit and the rumble filter is great since it is set to a very low frequency. The capacitance switch seems to do nothing, but the range works fine for the Ortofon I’m using. It sounds fine when the gain is left in the middle (0). No complaints, seems well made.
customer_reviews.author: noTop Contributor: Bass Guitars & Gear

customer_reviews.title: Remarkable improvement in vinyl quality
customer_reviews.text: The first upgrade I made to my AT-LP120-USB was adding this preamp. The sound is more full and detailed even before I remove the stock preamp built into the turnable - fuller, sharper, clearer. I strongly, STRONGLY recommend this, especially if you're dumb like me and paying for 180g vinyl without anything else between it and your amp! I looked at a few preamps at much higher prices but in the end wanted to play in the lower end before I continued dumping money into this hipster-ass hobby... I'm happy I did. It's a great box.
customer_reviews.author: PS

customer_reviews.title: BUSTED.  RIGHT CHANNEL FAIL JULY 15, 2020. DO NOT PURCHASE. POOR QUALITY.
customer_reviews.text: This device got my c. 1980 turntable up and running. I really didn’t realize I would need a preamp when I started my project and not knowing if my equipment was functioning after many years in storage I didn’t want to spend a ton but I did want quality. This unit fits that description exactly. One of the most satisfying Amazon purchases. Ever. And thank you to the “audiophiles” and other geeks that take the time to submit technical reviews. It is very helpful regarding matters as serious as playing records. The lights are too bright. Haha. July 2020 right channel failed. Product is broken and useless. DO NOT PURCHASE. POOR QUALITY.
customer_reviews.author: geofferson

customer_reviews.title: Like the gain adjust. Good sound
customer_reviews.text: I dislike that this doesn't have a power switch, and the LED is extremely bright. That said, it's really good sound in this price range. Skip over the $25-45 range of preamps and this is a worthwhile starter. *** I sometimes stream my vinyl over bluetooth when I need to listen more quietly in another room. This allows me to hook up a bluetooth transmitter to the out and use the gain adjust to get a nice, strong, line level.
customer_reviews.author: E

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this despite being advised to get something a little more expensive and have had 0 problems. It sounds just as good as those that I was recommended to buy for a fraction of the price. If I had some larger speakers that had a little more output I may try something a little more powerful but I would definitely try this first because it saved me a ton of money. It’s also very nice how accessible the controls are being on the front.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Jack

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for a while
customer_reviews.text: worked well for 8 months, then one channel went out. Amazon pointed me at the manufacturer for warranty work. At $65 for replacement, it's hardly worth driving to the next city (twice) to drop it off and pick it up. The whole thing should be like craftsman tools - plunk it on the counter and walk out with a new one, no questions asked. The unit does have great features. The gain knob is really useful in my setup because the turntable is across the room from the amplifier and it's easier to use the knob than to fumble with a remote volume control. The low cut is also nice.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Duncan

customer_reviews.title: This little box is like upgrading to an audiophile level cartridge
customer_reviews.text: I went from a pro ject phone preamp e which is about $60-80 to ART pro for $39. This phono preamp is a unicorn. It cleaned up all my bass and made all other instruments notably more distinct. It’s not much to look at but this is the most remarkable part of my rig based on performance and cost. Don’t hesitate. To those who say preamps only convert signal and can’t change or enhance sound and instruments, it’s simply not true. This little box is like upgrading to an audiophile level cartridge. Awesome product!
customer_reviews.author: corb C

customer_reviews.title: Great Sound
customer_reviews.text: Sounds better than the built-in phono stage of my Onkyo TX-8160. This one has a switchable input impedance of 100 pF or 200 pF, which makes an audible difference for my Audio Technica AT95E cartridge. Result: Better bass, harmonic richness and dynamics. I'm running it with the factory 9v wall wart power supply. I have ordered a 12v DC battery pack to see if I can improve the sound further. At this price and with the 30-day return guarantee, it pays to experiment.
customer_reviews.author: Riesgo DelFiasco

customer_reviews.title: Good value and unit.
customer_reviews.text: Sounds good, no hum or distortion even with the gain all the way up. Running a very old Pioneer PL 100 turntable through a theater system as the receiver (no phono inputs). Was using a Sony receiver prior and this unit and sounds as good as the Sony rec w/phono input. Didn't notice any difference in the CAP input; maybe a better receiver (and younger ears) would catch the difference. Blue light is annoying so I unplug the unit. Would reccomend.
customer_reviews.author: Pm

customer_reviews.title: Sound is as good, if not better
customer_reviews.text: Works as claimed. The preamp on my Onkyo receiver took a dive, so rather than replace the receiver, I bought this unit. Sound is as good, if not better, than before. Quick service to boot. The bright blue light that others have complained about was resolved by plugging the ART preamp into the powerstrip that runs the turntable, I switch the power strip off when not using the turntable, and no troublesome light. This ought to prolong the life of the preamp as well, as it won't be on all the time.
customer_reviews.author: A. T. Honeyager

customer_reviews.title: It works well!
customer_reviews.text: Nice improvement over the built in phono stage of my Soundcraftsmen DX4200 PRE. I set the dial to 0 (12 o'clock) on this device (the ART ProAudio). The clipping LED is on solid at 0, but it sounds very good to me. My power amps are a pair of Bob Latinos's M125s with KT120s for the output stage going into a pair of Phase Linear P580s. It almost sounds as good as my long gone (circa 82 dead in 1994...RIP) Yamaha C50 phono stage used to sound. Anyway, nice little unit, I like it! I have a ridiculous number of LPs still, so this is a good thing.
customer_reviews.author: Claude

customer_reviews.title: Incredible difference in sound, wow!
customer_reviews.text: Unbelievable what a difference this makes. I was using a newer player with an older receiver, always thought the receiver sounded a little "muted". Well, put this thing in between and HOLY COW. It's like I've been listening to the music turned really down low like an old fart. My vinyl sounds awesome now and my rig is complete!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Bain

customer_reviews.title: Solid hardware
customer_reviews.text: Does the job really well. My only complaint is that the power indicator is a bright blue light on the front that spoils the effect of the black fabric on the front of my av cabinet.
customer_reviews.author: Just Jon

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful!
customer_reviews.text: My old Pyle phone preamp died and I set out to find a replacement. Tried a couple of "tube" preamps, both failed miserably, and got returned. Decided to spend a little extra and try this one. Love it so far! One thing that is lacking is an ON/OFF switch as some of the reviewers have noticed. So, I went ahead and ordered a switchable outlet power switch with a chord that can be nested nearby. I don't find the light to be too bright. Looks kinda cool! Nice materials, and overall good construction. Let's see how long it lasts! Have fun.
customer_reviews.author: Kareem

customer_reviews.title: Very solid preamp.
customer_reviews.text: Paired with a Fluance RT82, and Ai60 speakers, all with fluance RCA cables. Metal casing and a firm, quality gain control knob. Exceptionally clean and clear sound. Printed on the bottom of the unit is a diagram explaining its operation. Very very solid preamp.
customer_reviews.author: jordaneagle220

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for the price, good upgrade over some phono stages
customer_reviews.text: Very good for the price. Prefer it to the phono stage on my fairly basic but still damn good Marantz PM 5005 receiver, adds some volume and oomph. Not a huge dramatic improvement, but enough that it's noticeable, and allows for a fairly significant volume boost. Pairing it with the Marantz plus Technics SL-7 and SL-6 TTs.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Dixon

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: The unit works well. I like the adjustable gain which allows maximum level from the turntable. The sound quality is good, and no noticeable distortion. The only gripe I have is there is no on-off switch, hence the 4-star rating. I'd give it 4.5 stars if possible. Other reviewers have commented on this also. This is not a major problem, and can be easily remedied. For me it's not a real issue since I route all components through a surge-protected power strip that I turn off when the system is not in use. I have a 40-year old Technics direct drive turntable that I am now able to use with my newer Sony home theater system.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond D. Edwards

customer_reviews.title: then you could spend a lot more and get a better sounding preamp
customer_reviews.text: This was just what I needed to get a 30 year old turntable working with a 5 year old receiver than has no phono input. I'm sure if you're a HUGE audiophile and have money to burn, then you could spend a lot more and get a better sounding preamp, but this provides clear sound with no hum or hiss.
customer_reviews.author: Tmach

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality product and poor manufacturer customer service
customer_reviews.text: This review is about the manufacturers customer service, rather than performance of the preamp. The AC adaptor died within six months of purchasing this and after light use. This was unfortunate but I understand that sometimes parts break, so I contacted ART to get a new one. 6 business days later and after a second contact attempt, I received an email with a part number, and asking for my address. I assumed that ART was going to mail a new one, but another 2 1/2 weeks later and after another unanswered email from me, I’ve given up and ordered the part from another vendor. Conclusion: poor quality product and poor manufacturers customer service.
customer_reviews.author: J Lou

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, good value
customer_reviews.text: Amazing bang for the buck, and fantastic sound. Only knock is the power supply can generate a bit of a hum, but get a ground loop isolater and run the output through it, or upgrade the power supply and this competes with the best of them. Would be 5 stars with an isolated power supply.
customer_reviews.author: PDXsasquatch

customer_reviews.title: I forgot how good analog can sound
customer_reviews.text: I have an original Technics Direct Drive turntable I picked up while in the military. It got packed away when CDs became popular. I have a large quantity of 12" singles I've always wanted to "digitize" but I was no longer able to use the turntable due to the different setup I currently have.I picked up a few pre-amps and tried them out but the sound never was quite "right". The sound was always to "raspy" as though electronically something wasn't quite matched. This gizmo did the trick. I forgot how good analog can sound! I have 40 yr old LPs sounding as though they were never played! Amazing. Glad I got it!
customer_reviews.author: Robert Bennett

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfectly.
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I needed for an "old school" turntable so it would play through my sound bar. Worked perfectly. I wish they would include an on/off switch. Unless the device you're using it for has a built-in switched outlet, this pre-amp is always on unless you unplug it. Another minor thing is that the blue power light is just too bright - especially in those applications where it's on all the time. Otherwise, I would have given it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: BF

customer_reviews.title: Too much Hum.
customer_reviews.text: I tried this pre-amp alongside a Pro-ject Phono Box E preamp. This was on an old Miracord 45 with an AT95EX cartridge. The sound quality was similar except for a pronounced low frequency hum that the ART DJ PreII produced. The low cut frequency switch, impedance switch, and variable gain were alluring features, but didn't make much of a difference. The blue LED power light is obnoxiously bright.
customer_reviews.author: anthony arens

customer_reviews.title: This product is amazing
customer_reviews.text: Omg why didn't I do this sooner. I am sitting here listening to a heliode re label recording of prelude and fugue BWV 544 as played by helmet Walcha and I am simply transfixed by the absolute Beaty of the sound that this little baby can create out of an somewhat preserved relic of my college passions. Throw your old preamp garage into a trash can grab this and maybe find your old college speakers lurking in your recesses and get a good ole fashioned power amp and travel back to all you one treasured. You won't regret this. Do not buy some Fancy Dan deal before you first try this.
customer_reviews.author: Marc F.

customer_reviews.title: Good unit for the money
customer_reviews.text: Performs as advertised. The adjustable gain is nice, as I can adjust the signal just below clipping, which varies with the recording. I can't hear a difference between the 100 and 200pfd settings with my Ortofon LM-10 cartridge, but I'll play with it a bit over time to see if it matters. Rumble filter doesn't seem to negatively hinder the bass, but I leave it off anyway as I don't have discs warped enough to cause visible woofer cycling. The blue LED is waaay too bright, but that's easily masked. Good unit for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Tomfoolery

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed!
customer_reviews.text: This Pre-amp really cleans up the sound from our Technics SL-DD22 turntable into a newer receiver! The gain adjustment lets us tailor it to the music we're listening to without clipping/distorting the input. I can't comment on longevity since it's only been in use for a few days, but there are some comments about a hum and having to unplug it since there's no power switch. Once the ground was connected between the turntable and the preamp the hum disappeared and plugging the supplied power adapter into the switched 120V outlet on the receiver turns the preamp off when the receiver is off.
customer_reviews.author: carman62

customer_reviews.title: Great sound out of this solid pre-amp
customer_reviews.text: I bought this unit to go with a new receiver without phono inputs. Adding this in provided better sound quality over my old receiver with a phono input. I appreciate the sound control that allows you to optimize gain. Feels like a very solid unit
customer_reviews.author: Bob on Books

customer_reviews.title: Nice pre amp for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I picked up this unit to bypass the pre amp on my new AT120x turntable.. overall cleaner sound ,gain and bass seperation. Relatively cheap way to improve TT performance a bit without upgrading the cartridge. I'm happy with the purchase so far.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Costs a lot - will not last
customer_reviews.text: Bought it in May, left channel dead by Dec. That is with light use, maybe 10 hours use max. Not happy. The company is also unresponsive to warranty claim filed online. Warranty is worthless.
customer_reviews.author: G

customer_reviews.title: Must have for a better Vinyl listening experience
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent product and has really improved the sound of my Audio Technica AT-LP120USB. I don't have an expensive set up at all just my turntable and some Edifier R1280T bookshelf speakers and this preamp has made a noticeable difference on the quality of sound I am getting from my vinyl. It is well worth the $50 to get even more out of your vinyl.
customer_reviews.author: robb

customer_reviews.title: Nice product!
customer_reviews.text: Worked like a charm for my old Pioneer PL-540. It has a gain knob for low output albums you can adjust with a peak (clip) light. Also has a low cut rumble filter which I needed due to my speakers going down to 18hz. Power light is wicked bright! I put some black electricians tape over it, problem solved.
customer_reviews.author: M. Wade

customer_reviews.title: but that was in the good ole days
customer_reviews.text: My older stereo amp used a built-in phono pre-amp, but that was in the good ole days. Modern day stereo amps may not provide a phone pre-amp. Thus, connecting a "vinyl" turntable is unworkable. This tiny little "black box" is the solution. It provides a working connection for stereo amps without a phono input.
customer_reviews.author: E. R. Morris

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful little pre-amp!
customer_reviews.text: My phonograph is an older, direct drive studio unit. The newer stereo systems do not have built-in preamps, and I will admit I was concerned that this unit would not do the system justice. I was very pleasantly surprised at the clarity it achieved. I agree with others the on light is annoying, but I can live with that. I do wish it had an on-off switch built in, it is a hassle remembering to unplug it when I'm finished working with albums. It works as well as advertised, perhaps better than I expected. No, back to some old Janis Joplin LP's!
customer_reviews.author: Robert Hartman

customer_reviews.title: Love this amp - trick is to reduce the output ...
customer_reviews.text: Love this amp - trick is to reduce the output by more than you think to make the thing shine - I run it at -2db and just turn up the volume - by doing this, there is much more headroom and less distortion when you have pops and clicks which actually reduces their intensity! Some people have gone down to -6db and have noticed a great sound as well.
customer_reviews.author: Kris Brzescinski

customer_reviews.title: Great value. Great with an LP60.
customer_reviews.text: This little preamp made quite a difference on our Audio Tenica LP60. I wasn't sure if it would be, but it was very noticeable in the mid-range and base. Also allowed our Kenwood amp to play with more volume than before. Easy setup. So far it seems like it's worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: BZ Builder

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sound qualtiy
customer_reviews.text: I repair stereos and these are by far the best bang for buck preamps. Sound quality is on par with $200 preamps, and surpasses any in this price range. Volume control and rumble filter are excellent useful features.
customer_reviews.author: Long Beach Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tone!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is fantastic! Sounds so much better than others I have tried, many costing much more! I would ignore the instructions that come with it, I have found the tone is best when there is no blinking or red in the green light whatsoever. I have been keeping my level around -2, but will bump it up for records that are produced at low levels, really never go past zero though.
customer_reviews.author: sean flannery

customer_reviews.title: Packaging was great and the shipping time was shorted than expecte
customer_reviews.text: The distance from my turntable to my receiver amplifier was apparently too much and my signal loss was to the point where the volume had to be almost at maximum level, resulting in a distorted sounds! This little jewel did the trick and boosted the signal where the music was normal, as was the volume. If you need a amplifier or pre-amp to boost your signal, this is the one to get. Packaging was great and the shipping time was shorted than expecte
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth W.

customer_reviews.title: easy to connect and awesome sound
customer_reviews.text: That's what I needed to play my old vinyl records, easy to connect and awesome sound. I also find that the main LED light is a bit brighter than other components, so I placed a small piece of scotch tape over the light to subdue the brightness. Just a small note, ground wire from the record player must be installed and I had to move the unit away from my CD player to eliminate the small hum that was present. Other than that love it..!!
customer_reviews.author: pecosapa

customer_reviews.title: Nice little bit of kit
customer_reviews.text: Nice little bit of kit. Does everything it says it does. Sounds pretty good. Brought my old vintage turntable out of storage, bought new cartridge and contacted to my hi end amp. Wow, what a sound. Brings more clarity than I remember my old built in phono preamp delivered. You do need to adjust the gain via the knob to ensure the signal is not clipping too much, else the volume will be attenuated. I usually adjust for each album played. Recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Benedmonton

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous! Adjustable gain and low cut filter vital for 78s!
customer_reviews.text: I have a collection of 78’s going back to 1912. The playback level varies wildly, so having adjustable gain is vital. No other preamp near this price has that feature. The low cut filter is also vital, because old 78s often contain tremendous subsonic noise. And the preamp just sounds great too!
customer_reviews.author: exhausted_homeowner

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last a year
customer_reviews.text: Right channel burned out after very light use. Should have bought a real one instead of a cheap $50 POS.
customer_reviews.author: NCC

customer_reviews.title: Great phono premap value
customer_reviews.text: Works as well as esoteric preamps I've tried before, but at a fraction of the cost. Works well, great dynamic range and even tone. Love the capacitance loading and rolloff switches. Also, like that I can dial back the input sensitivity for really strong cartridges like the Shure M77. This makes it easy to keep from overloading the electronics, or give a boost for weakly modulated records.
customer_reviews.author: Marvin W.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing in Every Way
customer_reviews.text: I'll keep this short. See Photonman's review for this product. My reason for getting one was the same as his, as was my experience after hooking it up. I don't want to say this too loudly but, . . . they could charge twice the price for this, and it would still be worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Mark S

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Put these in place at work a couple years ago. Regularly used and still working. Got one for personal use for my new turntables. Sounds good. I know my needle is a little off but it compensates for my error. Also it doesn't clip if you kick the table or are putting down heavy bass. Works great at home or in a professional setting.
customer_reviews.author: deimos

customer_reviews.title: Sound quality and amplification are amazing! I would recommend to anyone
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality and amplification are amazing! I would recommend to anyone. And I would buy it again in a heartbeat. At first I tried to boost up the amplification to about a +2 and +3 but it sounded too "Bright" or "Tweeny". I then set it to 0 and it sounded better - but for my system and my ears a -2 was perfect. Clear and clean and absolutely perfect. Could not be happier.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: I am beyond pleased with this product
customer_reviews.text: It works! I just took it out of the box, plugged it in, connected my turntable through the converter to my receiver's Video2 port (the only open port), and put the needle arm on the record. MUSIC! First time I've been able to listen to my 33 1/3 albums in a long, long time. I was almost afraid to try it, because some electronics don't live up to their promotion. This one does! It couldn't have been easier. Now that I've used it for almost 30 minutes, I am beyond pleased with this product. I'll write again if I notice any issues after using it for a while.
customer_reviews.author: Kentucky Fran

customer_reviews.title: Yup!
customer_reviews.text: I was going through changing everything on a recently acquired turn table I got from my grandparents. I'm not audio savvy so I consulted YouTube to see why I was only getting faint sound. This was highly ranked on multiple videos I watched. Caught it on sale for $33. It gives you a clean sounding boost. Just what the doctor ordered.
customer_reviews.author: Beau Chad

customer_reviews.title: great pre amp
customer_reviews.text: this is a solid preamp that produces great sound quality. my only issue with it is there is no power button so the blue light is always on unless you unplug it. would be 5 stars if it had a power switch
customer_reviews.author: loveliestmelody

customer_reviews.title: Sounds amazing, ultra low noise. Received in 1 day through Prime.
customer_reviews.text: This unit sounds amazing, especially for the price. No noise or hiss. I did ground my Sony PS-4750 to the preamp. I used to play the turntable through a low gain guitar amp. This is a huge improvement, even through my Pioneer Elite Aux input. I'm very happy. Minus 1 star for no off switch. It's simple enough to unplug it, but it's annoying. I wish it didn't have a wall wart (power adapter) but it is likely performance related. If the transformer was in the box, it would likely be noisy.
customer_reviews.author: Scooby

customer_reviews.title: Excellent turntable pre-amp
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical of this pre amp due to its low price but proved to be an excellent addition to my stereo system. The hook up (of course) was simple but the results (as compared to my old pre amp) were astounding. The sound is clear with no hum and no apparent noise from the turntable and cartridge combination I had been using for the past couple of years. The sound quality is excellent. Great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: iacevedo

customer_reviews.title: Works PERFECTLY and sounds great. If you need a Pre-amp
customer_reviews.text: This thing is the Shiznizzy. I used it to hook a Vintage 70's era Turntable to a 60's era console stereo that I am rebuilding. The phonograph itself on the old console was shot as was the Pre-amp portion of the amp/tuner. Rather than going through the hassle of fixing all this, I bought this little pre-amp and ran it though the aux ports on the old console. Works PERFECTLY and sounds great. If you need a Pre-amp....BUY THIS
customer_reviews.author: S. Bales

customer_reviews.title: Phono preamp
customer_reviews.text: Love this little phono amp I can definitely hear the diffrence in quiality compaired to mt Stellar Lab preamp sound is more clear on high and low ends... My only complaint it doesn't have a power off switch...
customer_reviews.author: Rafael

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: My new Audio-Technica turntable did not sound as powerful as expected. With the addition of this preamplifier, the improvement was amazing. The setup was very easy (and I am a 66 year old woman with no technical expertise). I connected the RCA plugs into one of the empty outlets for a DVR/VCR2 on my Yamaha receiver, and I plugged the electrical cord into a switched outlet on the receiver. The unit turns off when the receiver is off. However, the blue light was extremely bright, but we covered it with electrical tape, and it is no longer noticeable. The output adjustment is easy and make a wonderful difference in the sound. I love listening to vinyl records again.
customer_reviews.author: jq

customer_reviews.title: Where is the On/Off switch?
customer_reviews.text: Before purchasing this product, I read many reviews of various phono preamps. None of the preamps I saw (including this one) had an On/Off switch. Why is that feature so difficult to include? Anyway, I am very happy with every other feature of this product. It is well-built, and functions nicely. Small size is a nice benefit. Works well and I think it would be tough to find a similar product quality at this price.
customer_reviews.author: Todd

customer_reviews.title: Awesome pre-amp...great value...
customer_reviews.text: Great little pre-amp... Extremely quiet ...way like low cut...gain control... I don’t use two types of phono-cartridges so I don’t need the impedance control... Great bang for the buck..
customer_reviews.author: Larry F. Schott III

customer_reviews.title: Great budget preamp
customer_reviews.text: Just received this pre-amp a few days ago after using a Pyle PP999 and am amazed at how much better it sounds - there is no hum, much clearer stereo separation, and nice, clean bass that just "walks". I'm using this with a Pro-Ject Primary with Ortofon OM-5E and am able to appreciate the better set-up now. I plan on upgrading the power supply in the future as some people have suggested to have cleaner DC power, but for now the included wall wart works. If you're on a budget and looking for a good preamp to get the most out of your system, go for this guy - you won't regret it!
customer_reviews.author: Philip Walczak

customer_reviews.title: Major Distortion - Denon
customer_reviews.text: Horrible distortion on my Denon, returned it for a credit. Your results may be better.
customer_reviews.author: BobG971

customer_reviews.title: Works great for my 50+ year old turntable console
customer_reviews.text: Works great for my 50+ year old turntable console. I didn't feel comfortable with using the original vacuum-tube-amp, this little guy does the trick with great results! I ran everything through my AUX input on my Samsung soundbar, works like a charm!
customer_reviews.author: osp98

customer_reviews.title: I cannot imagine a better value for the $
customer_reviews.text: I needed a phono preamp to replace the one within the Teac TN-300 turntable - which produced no bass and a flat sound. I cannot imagine a better value for the $. I used cheap cables (rca-to-rca and rca to phono plug) from Amazon to plug the turntable into the DJPRE II phono preamp and then into some Bose Companion Computer Speakers - for a very solid and clear sound. More than happy for the $.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen W Schilffarth

customer_reviews.title: Just the ticket
customer_reviews.text: I am using this to boost the signal from an old but excellent turntable so I can digitize my vinyl collection. It is exactly the right item for the right price.
customer_reviews.author: dskdan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Phono Preamp
customer_reviews.text: This preamp more than gets the job done. For $50, you can't do better. I have mine hooked up to my Pro-Ject Debut Carbon. It produces excellent sound quality and range with very little hum that is only noticeable when the needle is in the deadwax at the end of the record. I use a heavy duty cable for the output to the speakers, which probably helps reduce hum. The input cable is just the standard cable that comes with the Pro-Ject. This is an excellent option for beginning audiophiles and anyone starting to invest in vinyl. I can't vouch for this on a $10,000 setup, but it is phenomenal with a decent setup.
customer_reviews.author: TowerOPower

customer_reviews.title: CLASS A
customer_reviews.text: EXCELLENT. PERFORMS EXACTLY AS DESCRIBED. COMPLETELY NEUTRAL---NO SONIC SIGNATURE/TRANSPARENT. USING WITH A LITTLE DOT TUBE PREAMP AND OLD PROTON D1200 AMP.WELL BUILT. PAID $49.00---AN INCREDIBLE BARGAIN !!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: MISSING A KEY PIECE!!!
customer_reviews.text: This was suppose to have an AC Adapter included with it. It clearly states that in the item description. And it did NOT!!
customer_reviews.author: Nasty Bob

customer_reviews.title: Great amplification and options.  Can't beat the price.
customer_reviews.text: Provides great amplification to my turntable. I use it with an Audio Technica LP120 with the internal amp switched off. Great buy. Super cheap but great quality
customer_reviews.author: KeziaPurrsTop Contributor: Violins

customer_reviews.title: My vinyl is back!
customer_reviews.text: Sound is much better than my old pre amp. Noise is reduced as well. I like the controls on the front. The only improvements would be a power switch, and a less bright power led. Clip light is great. Tops for this price range.
customer_reviews.author: DT

customer_reviews.title: Frustrated
customer_reviews.text: I have been waiting for this preamp like a child waiting on a new toy. The box was open and the AC adapter was not in. I do not want to return it as I need it for Thanksgiving Day. I am going out to buy an adapter. Frustrated and disappointed. I hope the preamp works well.
customer_reviews.author: jesus ranero

customer_reviews.title: Easy to hook up
customer_reviews.text: Was exactly what I needed for hooking up older record player to newer receiver. Before this preamp the record player was really quiet, but now with the preamp it is plenty loud with gain set a little over halfway. Easy to hook up. As someone else mentioned the blue power led is very bright.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Riess

customer_reviews.title: Why no on-off switch?
customer_reviews.text: It's perfect except that there's no on-off switch, and while that's OK if you have a phonograph with an extra power outlet as part of it, I do not. Aside from that, though, it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Robert A. Donner

customer_reviews.title: No issues with sound quality
customer_reviews.text: My problem with this isn't with the quality of the audio that it produced, in fact with the speakers I have it sounded pretty good. The issue I had was with its quality. After a week of use it stopped receiving power. Turned out the adapter it came with was defective and ended up burning out the unit. It's unfortunate that my experience with it hasn't been as positive as some of the other comments here and, perhaps, I just got unlucky. I've sent several emails to ART over the past two weeks requesting support with no reply yet.
customer_reviews.author: Anita E. Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Best money I've spent on my sound system so far.
customer_reviews.text: Treated the typical issues with an 80's turntable and mid priced receiver. Your looking at pre-amp die to issues, I looked and asked multiple questions to friends, and all roads lead to this.
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: the online reviews are true
customer_reviews.text: bought this on the recommendations of many online. and it is true. I had to use a different adaptor as my country's voltage is different from the US, but it worked very well. been using it for a few weeks now and so far so good. best value for money I would say. I highly recommend the dj preII to those on a budget. you will not be disappointed. only negative is I wished it could go louder as I had to put more volume on my power amp.
customer_reviews.author: Jason de Souza

customer_reviews.title: Cant go wrong with this awesome phono preamp
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing the best value for the money i have seen or used. Use it with my Rega and couldnt be happier with this thing
customer_reviews.author: david gabbard

customer_reviews.title: Recommended
customer_reviews.text: Works very well. Be sure to use quality cables as the output to your stereo system. Initially, I used an old set of stereo cables and I was disappointed. I then used upgraded cables and I am satisfied with the output of my resurrected 30 year old turntable.
customer_reviews.author: Rider

customer_reviews.title: Works fine. Nothing special. Good price.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a cheaper phono pre-amp and it sounded terrible. This one sounds much better but cost twice as much. If you just need to get a signal to your amp or pre-amp and get clean decent sound, this is a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Flem Snopes

customer_reviews.title: It Works!
customer_reviews.text: I have nothing to compare it to, but it works for me. The blue light is indeed terrible and bad design, but I like that there's a button for reducing bass as my speakers were moving like crazy before i used the lower bass setting, which adds another strong LED light :)
customer_reviews.author: E. Kfir

customer_reviews.title: ... all the time) but for the money it's a fantastic value. The over-drive indicator is a nice touch
customer_reviews.text: I've only had it playing for 4 hours or so (powered up all the time) but for the money it's a fantastic value. The over-drive indicator is a nice touch. Haven't tried different power supplies yet but I'd expect it would improve the sound a bit more. But for the money? Don't hesitate.
customer_reviews.author: Adam A

customer_reviews.title: Sounds great!
customer_reviews.text: I’m really impress with the sound quality of this little thing. One video here I heard humming noise but I don’t hear it on mine. Like what everyone said on their review that the blue power light is really bright and no ON/OFF switch which is not a show stopper for me as long as it sounds great.
customer_reviews.author: ROBERTO BAUTISTA

customer_reviews.title: Probably the best phono preamp available for under $100
customer_reviews.text: Probably the best phono preamp available for under $100, and it sells for 1/2 that. That, my friends, is value. Don't waste your money on cheap junk - the good stuff starts here..
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: Works great for my Fluance RT85. This is totally worth it, specially if you are starting with turntables.
customer_reviews.author: Marccelo

customer_reviews.title: Good little product for the price
customer_reviews.text: Good little product for the price. I've tried the plug and play, cheap and expensive, and I gotta say at least buy something with a gain control like this. Can't beat the price. Paired it with my Debut Carbon and I got some good good tunes rolling now. Still tweaking to do and can't speak for longevity but sound is decent enough for me. It's freaking $55 bills dudes!
customer_reviews.author: Justin Green

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my needs
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this preamp based primarily after reading other reviews and was not disaapointed. For the price and my simple needs it worked perfect! It could not be any simplier plug and play. I was looking for a pre amp to work with my older turntable to my new souround sound system which wasn't designed for turntable use. I would probably give it 5 stars however there were no instructions and the very high freq response are notably lost. It does function properly and I can now listen and enjoy my old vinyl from my youth. For that I cannot complain, worth the purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Vic Mosby

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: Works beautifully. No issues to report, it connected my Technics turntable to my Pioneer AV Receiver without a problem. I connected a bare wire between the ground terminal on the preamp to the ground terminal on the turntable, so no hum. Just beautiful sound from my old vinyl.
customer_reviews.author: Edward

customer_reviews.title: Works great with my Bose Lifestyle V35 system.
customer_reviews.text: I unpacked, plugged it in, and set the gain to 0. My Turntable plays beautifully with my Newer Bose receiver. I set the sound to 5.1 surround, even though the records were never pressed with that in mind, and it sounds great! My old records have new life again. This amp is perfect and great for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Larhill66

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice PreAmp for the Money
customer_reviews.text: Having bought ART products in the past I was always impressed with their product. The sound and build quality is great and works well patching it directly into my Digital Mixer.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick J. Cassidy

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: It lost half it's power. Didn't even last a year.
customer_reviews.author: D. von Schramm

customer_reviews.title: Small, but mighty!
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Hooked up quickly and I'm now listening to my records! The LED lights on the front are bright as previous reviewers have mentioned. I just put a bit of electrical tape over it and done. The very small dimensions means it tucks nicely into my cabinet among my other components. I'm very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: 666k9s

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected!
customer_reviews.text: We are a home automation company and our client wanted remote racks 100 feet away and a local family room tv. The turntable and phono input were not capable of pushing the signal alone, not even over Cat5 analog audio baluns! We bought this unit and no issue, plenty of power. Outstanding product, does more than expected!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Blinding LED!
customer_reviews.text: Works great, about the size of 2 decks of cards with sturdy housing. Unfortunately there is no power button on the amp itself so that blue LED is on non-stop and people are not kidding on how bright it is. Lights up my living room at night! Plug this sucker into a power strip so you can quickly switch it off.
customer_reviews.author: J. Hanke

product_meta.title: ART DJPREII Phono Preamplifier
product_meta.description:
The DJ PRE II (formerly named the "Phono MicroPRE") acts as an interface between your turntable and your audio recording / playback system. The analog input capacitance can be switched between 100pF and 200pF to optimize your phono cartridge response. A switchable low cut filter removes turntable rumble while leaving the audio pristine. The front gain trim control and signal/clip LED allow you to optimize the preamp's gain for a wide range of input sources. The built-in low noise phono preamp circuitry is highly accurate and precisely conforms to the RIAA standard. The line output jacks are low impedance and can be used with any sound card.

Housed in an all aluminum black anodized case, the DJ PRE II can be powered by a wide variety of external supplies. If you need to amplify and EQ your vinyl records to interface with your audio workstation, sound card, home stereo system or main monitor system, the DJ PRE II gives you flawless audio reproduction in a rugged and reliable package.
feature_bullets: Dimensions: 1.75 H x 4.2 W x 3.5 inches D (44.5 x 107 x 89mm)
